00020 #ifndef _XENO_NUCLEUS_TIMER_H
00021 #define _XENO_NUCLEUS_TIMER_H
00022 
00023 #include <nucleus/queue.h>
00024 
00025 #if defined(__KERNEL__) || defined(__XENO_UVM__) || defined(__XENO_SIM__)
00026 
00027 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_OPT_TIMING_PERIODIC
00028 /* Number of outstanding timers (hint only) -- must be ^2 */
00029 #define XNTIMER_WHEELSIZE 64
00030 #define XNTIMER_WHEELMASK (XNTIMER_WHEELSIZE - 1)
00031 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_OPT_TIMING_PERIODIC */
00032 
00033 #define XNTIMER_ENABLED   0x00000001
00034 #define XNTIMER_DEQUEUED  0x00000002
00035 #define XNTIMER_KILLED    0x00000004
00036 
00037 /* These flags are available to the real-time interfaces */
00038 #define XNTIMER_SPARE0  0x01000000
00039 #define XNTIMER_SPARE1  0x02000000
00040 #define XNTIMER_SPARE2  0x04000000
00041 #define XNTIMER_SPARE3  0x08000000
00042 #define XNTIMER_SPARE4  0x10000000
00043 #define XNTIMER_SPARE5  0x20000000
00044 #define XNTIMER_SPARE6  0x40000000
00045 #define XNTIMER_SPARE7  0x80000000
00046 
00047 #define XNTIMER_LOPRIO  (-999999999)
00048 #define XNTIMER_STDPRIO 0
00049 #define XNTIMER_HIPRIO  999999999
00050 
00051 #define XNTIMER_KEEPER_ID 0
00052 
00053 typedef struct {
00054     xnholder_t link;
00055     xnticks_t key;
00056     int prio;
00057 
00058 #define link2tlholder(laddr) \
00059     ((xntlholder_t *)(((char *)laddr) - offsetof(xntlholder_t, link)))
00060 
00061 } xntlholder_t;
00062 #define xntlholder_date(h)       ((h)->key)
00063 #define xntlholder_prio(h)       ((h)->prio)
00064 #define xntlholder_init(h)       inith(&(h)->link)
00065 #define xntlist_init(q)       (initq(q),0)
00066 #define xntlist_destroy(q)    do { } while (0)
00067 #define xntlist_head(q)                         \
00068     ({ xnholder_t *_h = getheadq(q);            \
00069         !_h ? NULL : link2tlholder(_h);         \
00070     })
00071 
00072 static inline void xntlist_insert(xnqueue_t *q, xntlholder_t *holder)
00073 {
00074     xnholder_t *p;
00075     
00076     /* Insert the new timer at the proper place in the single
00077        queue managed when running in aperiodic mode. O(N) here,
00078        but users of the aperiodic mode need to pay a price for
00079        the increased flexibility... */
00080 
00081     for (p = q->head.last; p != &q->head; p = p->last)
00082         if (holder->key > link2tlholder(p)->key ||
00083             (holder->key == link2tlholder(p)->key &&
00084              holder->prio <= link2tlholder(p)->prio))
00085             break;
00086         
00087     insertq(q,p->next,&holder->link);
00088 }
00089 
00090 #define xntlist_remove(q, h)  removeq((q),&(h)->link)
00091 
00092 #if defined(CONFIG_XENO_OPT_TIMER_HEAP)
00093 #include <nucleus/bheap.h>
00094 typedef bheaph_t xntimerh_t;
00095 #define xntimerh_date(h)       bheaph_key(h)
00096 #define xntimerh_prio(h)       bheaph_prio(h)
00097 #define xntimerh_init(h)       bheaph_init(h)
00098 typedef bheap_t xntimerq_t;
00099 #define xntimerq_init(q)       bheap_init((q), CONFIG_XENO_OPT_TIMER_HEAP_CAPACITY)
00100 #define xntimerq_destroy(q)    bheap_destroy(q)
00101 #define xntimerq_head(q)       bheap_gethead(q)
00102 #define xntimerq_insert(q, h)  bheap_insert((q),(h))
00103 #define xntimerq_remove(q, h)  bheap_delete((q),(h))
00104 
00105 #else /* CONFIG_XENO_OPT_TIMER_LIST */
00106 typedef xntlholder_t xntimerh_t;
00107 #define xntimerh_date(h)       xntlholder_date(h)
00108 #define xntimerh_prio(h)       xntlholder_prio(h)
00109 #define xntimerh_init(h)       xntlholder_init(h)
00110 typedef xnqueue_t xntimerq_t;
00111 #define xntimerq_init(q)       xntlist_init(q)
00112 #define xntimerq_destroy(q)    xntlist_destroy(q)
00113 #define xntimerq_head(q)       xntlist_head(q)
00114 #define xntimerq_insert(q,h)   xntlist_insert((q),(h))
00115 #define xntimerq_remove(q, h)  xntlist_remove((q),(h))
00116 
00117 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_OPT_TIMER_LIST */
00118 
00119 struct xnsched;
00120 
00121 typedef struct xntimer {
00122 
00123     xntimerh_t aplink;          /* Link in aperiodic timers list. */
00124 
00125 #define aplink2timer(laddr) \
00126     ((xntimer_t *)(((char *)(laddr)) - (int)(&((xntimer_t *)0)->aplink)))
00127 
00128 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_OPT_TIMING_PERIODIC
00129     xntlholder_t plink;         /* Link in periodic timers wheel. */
00130 
00131 #define plink2timer(laddr) \
00132     ((xntimer_t *)(((char *)(laddr)) - (int)(&((xntimer_t *)0)->plink)))
00133 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_OPT_TIMING_PERIODIC */
00134 
00135     xnflags_t status;           /* !< Timer status. */
00136 
00137     xnticks_t interval;         /* !< Periodic interval (in ticks, 0 == one shot). */
00138 
00139     struct xnsched *sched;      /* !< Sched structure to which the timer is
00140                                    attached. */
00141 
00142     void (*handler)(void *cookie); /* !< Timeout handler. */
00143 
00144     void *cookie;       /* !< Cookie to pass to the timeout handler. */
00145 
00146     XNARCH_DECL_DISPLAY_CONTEXT();
00147 
00148 } xntimer_t;
00149 
00150 #if defined(CONFIG_SMP)
00151 #define xntimer_sched(t)          ((t)->sched)
00152 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00153 #define xntimer_sched(t)          xnpod_current_sched()
00154 #endif /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00155 #define xntimer_interval(t)       ((t)->interval)
00156 #define xntimer_set_cookie(t,c)   ((t)->cookie = (c))
00157 
00158 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_OPT_TIMING_PERIODIC
00159 #define xntimer_set_priority(t,p) ({                    \
00160             xntimer_t *_t = (t);                        \
00161             unsigned prio = (p);                        \
00162             xntimerh_prio(&(_t)->aplink) = prio;        \
00163             xntlholder_prio(&(_t)->plink) = prio;       \
00164         })
00165 #else /* !CONFIG_XENO_OPT_TIMING_PERIODIC */
00166 #define xntimer_set_priority(t,p) (xntimerh_prio(&(t)->aplink) = (p))
00167 #endif /* !CONFIG_XENO_OPT_TIMING_PERIODIC */
00168 
00169 static inline int xntimer_active_p (xntimer_t *timer)
00170 {
00171     return timer->sched != NULL;
00172 }
00173 
00174 static inline int xntimer_running_p (xntimer_t *timer)
00175 {
00176     return !testbits(timer->status,XNTIMER_DEQUEUED);
00177 }
00178 
00179 typedef struct xntmops {
00180 
00181     void (*do_tick)(void);
00182     xnticks_t (*get_jiffies)(void);
00183     xnticks_t (*get_raw_clock)(void);
00184     void (*do_timer_start)(xntimer_t *timer,
00185                            xnticks_t value,
00186                            xnticks_t interval);
00187     void (*do_timer_stop)(xntimer_t *timer);
00188     xnticks_t (*get_timer_date)(xntimer_t *timer);
00189     xnticks_t (*get_timer_timeout)(xntimer_t *timer);
00190     xnticks_t (*get_timer_raw_expiry)(xntimer_t *timer);
00191     void (*set_timer_remote)(xntimer_t *timer);
00192     const char *(*get_type)(void);
00193     void (*freeze)(void);
00194 
00195 } xntmops_t;

00236 static inline void xntimer_stop(xntimer_t *timer)
00237 {
00238     if (!testbits(timer->status,XNTIMER_DEQUEUED))
00239         nktimer->do_timer_stop(timer);
00240 }
00241 
00242 void xntimer_freeze(void);
00243 
00244 xnticks_t xntimer_get_date(xntimer_t *timer);
00245 
00246 xnticks_t xntimer_get_timeout(xntimer_t *timer);
00247 
00248 void xntimer_set_periodic_mode(void);
00249 
00250 void xntimer_set_aperiodic_mode(void);

00255 #define xntimer_set_sched(timer,sched)
00256 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
